change-case|wma|1.0.0
local-history|xyz|1.4.0
inserttimestamp|zvl|1.1.3

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. in user prefs, set `"editor.rulers": [80]`
2. Single column editor: the ruler is not displayed.
3. Dual column editor: the ruler is displayed in the second column
3. Three columns editor: the ruler is displayed in 2nd and 3rd column
4. Switch to stacked editor layout: the ruler is not displayed in any editor.


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes !

data.title: Prompt user if there is a collision in file to language association (two extensions registering different languages for a file extension)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi, I am trying to write an extension that recognizes ".spec" files as [Gauge](https://getgauge.io/) language. However, if a user has installed some plugins the file association is overridden by the other extension. I noticed that my extension does not even get activated in this case. Is there any way that this can be prevented, other than the user changing the settings per workspace? Something that can be done in the extension itself would be useful.
Or when a new extension is installed, can the user choose the default file association if there are conflicts.

data.title: class URI cannot represent relative file paths
Allow navigation in Word Wrapped line
data.body:
As you can see in the following image, in Sublime Text you can navigate the contents of **one line** when the Word Wrap option is enabled. When you have Word Wrap enabled in VS Code it won't navigate inside the wrapped line but instead it will change line.

![zobzpczsbl](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5990379/30478255-08a2f3b0-9a19-11e7-83af-d9c7afea7a94.gif)

- OS Version: macOS 10.12.1

data.title: Cannot create multi-key bindings on linux with swapped CTRL and CAPS
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:26:20.018Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-33-generic
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
crystal-lang|fau|0.3.3
vscode-emacs-friendly|lfs|0.8.0

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Swap CTRL and CAPS LOCK keys either using `gnome-tweak-tool` or `xmodmap` as described e.g.
 [here](https://askubuntu.com/questions/363346/how-to-permanently-switch-caps-lock-and-esc).
2. Make sure the rebound keys work as expected in other applications.
2. Find a command you want to map to.
3. Try to map the command to e.g. Ctrl+x Ctrl+m

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: [scss] wrong color decorators on colors with variables
data.body:
Feature request and possibly a bug with the colorDecorators
The integrated color previewer in VS code doesn't understand the variable value and show black. obviously there is a syntax difference from sass rgba and css rgba, would it be possible to change the behavior according to the syntax?

It was already requested to parse the variables and show their colors and I find that colorize does it pretty well.

Like in the other issue https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21705, Atom has plugin for that.

- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: Windows 8

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Create a scss file
2. type inside 
```scss
$input-border: #cccccc; //handled by colorDecorators and colorize
$input-border-focus: darken($input-border, 10%); //not handled by anyone
$input-border-test: rgba($input-border, 0.7); //not handled correctly by the colorDecorators for sass
$input-border-test1: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.7); // handled by colorDecorators

$test: $input-border; //handled by colorize
$test2: $input-border-focus;  //not handled by anyone
```

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Extract the integrated terminal

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
"Feature" request.

The integrated terminal grows in functionality, to the point that it could soon become very useful standalone, as its *own app*. I'm only a casual VScode user (using vim most of the time), but I would definitely be interested in a well-behaved, consistent, reactively-configurable, multi-platform terminal not tied to the editor.

Obviously if such a situation were to unfold, the shared component (not entirely dissimilar to VTE) should be jointly developed and shared with VScode. Both could be able to leverage a common configuration so that whether a terminal leveraging such a theoretical common component is spawned within VScode or standalone, they behave the same.

data.title: Allow decorations to be anchored to the end of lines

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body: I'm using text editor decorations to annotate the closing brackets of nested constructs to improve code readability for things like Flutter widgets (these methods have lots of nested calls, similar to React render methods): Originally I anchored the decorations to the closing bracket, but when multiple items ended on the same line it was strange to have the decorations inserted between the users characters. So I tweaked this to instead always anchor them at the last character of the line, and stack them up (they appear as `// a // b // c`). It all generally works great, however because they're not actually anchored to the end of the line, but rather the character that happens to be at the end of the line, it's possible for the user to put the cursor behind the last character and type a new character, which appears after the decoration (for a brief period, until it gets updated by my code): ![Typing behind the labels](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/156888/29633236-7793b0ba-87fa-11e7-9313-8f654fe49c16.gif) I don't think I can really fix this, unless Code had support for anchoring a decoration to the end of the line properly (without me just using the last character). Is this something you'd consider? I appreciate I might not be using decorations for whatever it was designed for, but this feature has very positive feedback, I'd really like to make it work!

data.title: [scss-css] Semicolon auto close & list of CSS property values (missing some atom's features)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: v. 1.16
- OS Version: Win 10 x64

I used to code my front-end in atom.io but now I've moved to VS Code and I really like it! I have in VS Code almost all features that atom.io has. But still missing 2 of them and no plugins or configs can help me as I understand.
So, they are: semicolon autoclose & list of CSS property values as it is performed in atom. Some screenshots are below:

First, I type a CSS property some letters, than select one I need and push Enter. And then such list appears:
![ex1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23461482/30472913-03b6d586-9a07-11e7-9c4d-a53b5ca9cb30.jpg)

After I've selected a value I tap Enter and atom places automaticaly a semicolon ;
![ex2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23461482/30472911-03afb10c-9a07-11e7-8f0f-d195fe5568d3.jpg)

So I wonder if any plugins which I don't know can help me? Or such features are/will be in future?
Thanks!

I see some special casing for specific extensions in `scripts/test-integration.sh`. Just pointing this out, since this implies they are not run on CI.

data.title: Breakpoint stopped event will cause all threads 'PAUSED ON BREAKPOINT'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.17.0-insider
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14052197/30472455-07f1f96e-9a2f-11e7-97fd-5a1dcecb28a1.png)

When developing java debugger, it supports breakpoint hit event only suspends a single thread and keeps other threads running. So for breakpoint hit event, our java debugger will send a stopped DA event with allThreadsStopped flag as false. See `{"event":"stopped","body":{"threadId":1,"reason":"breakpoint","allThreadsStopped":false,"type":"stopped"},"seq":11,"type":"event"}`. But vscode shows all threads are `PAUSED ON BREAKPOINT`.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14052197/30472579-afd311cc-9a2f-11e7-8eb5-7424cd30c572.png)

I remember vscode works before, and it will only display `PAUSED ON BREAKPOINT` on the related thread. It seems a regression bug.

- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: W10 Home

In previous versions you could write `<div>`, press enter and get a newline. Pressing enter in 1.16.1 now closes the tag.
Please bring back the old behaviour when autoClosingTags is set to false.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set html.autoClosingTags to false
2. Write `<div>`
3. Press enter
4. Enter should give a newline, not close the tag

data.title: Enhancements to snippetSuggestions? Custom priorities?
data.body:
Hi,

it looks like the setting `editor.snippetSuggestions` is a little bit limited in the moment. It would be nice, if the priority of a snippet could be configured in a smarter way. Currently I have set it to `top` and have the following behaviour. 

Say I have a custom snippet called `imp`.

1) Now I have an empty file and type `i`.

- Nice to have: I'd like to see my custom snippet `imp` first.
- Current behaviour: I see the built in snippets (?) `if` and `ifelse` first.

2) Now I have a `import {} from 'foo'` and my cursor is inside `{}`. I expect `'foo'` to export a constant called `installer` and type `i`.

- Nice to have: I'd like to see my `installer` as an auto complete suggestion.
- Current behaviour: I see the built in snippets (?) `if` and `ifelse` and my custom `imp` snippet first, even though they are invalid here.

---

My current workaround: I prefix snippets with some char like `!` to avoid collisions :)

data.title: Please delete the `new release` and the `insiders` tag
data.body:
It makes no sense that it exists. I constantly keep removing it from my issues.

If we want such a functionality, simply tag it with the actual version number; although I suggest to not even do that since that is already in the issue's body.

cc @Microsoft/vscode for opinions

data.title: Avoid sync fs calls in workbench: TerminalTaskSystem.findExecutable

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
In the renderer we want to stay away from sync fs API calls to node.js because each call will stop the VM from doing anything. We should try to use the async fs APIs. 

The code in question is: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/tasks/electron-browser/terminalTaskSystem.ts#L602

data.title: PHP indentation usually breaks when pasting over a method
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write some PHP code
2. Select a method (class function) in full with some whitespace before it so that pasting it twice will result in the right thing being duplicated
3. Copy (command+c)
4. Paste (command+v) twice
5. Observe strange indentation:

![weird-indentation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1070702/30467739-4b6e9896-9a2a-11e7-968e-a4452e16c5db.gif)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Avoid sync fs calls in workbench: extensionTipsService
data.body:
In the renderer we want to stay away from sync fs API calls to node.js because each call will stop the VM from doing anything. We should try to use the async fs APIs. 

The code in question is: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/6c4274d7e53913cc905dcd20e59f6d7a9c4b7697/src/vs/workbench/parts/extensions/electron-browser/extensionTipsService.ts#L343
